page.title: 03CHURCHES
page.content: There are two churches in the area: {St Peter and St Paul}in{Charlton Adam and{St Mary the Virgin}in{Charlton {Mackrell. { St Peter and St Paul}consists of chancel'nave'south chapel and porch and west tower.The chancel is early 14th century in origin with a 15th century east window.The rest of the fabric seems to be mainly 15th century but the chapel may be a little later.The restored roofs are of local wagon type so characteristic of the west country. Charlton Adam church was restored in 1893.The pulpit is 17th century of simple Jacobean character. In the church there are some monuments to Thomas Basket (1592),Anne Strangways(1638) and Giles Strangways(1677).The font with round bowl and shaft is late 12th.century.
